intro: Halophila aschersonii, commonly known as shoal grass, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the Alismataceae family. It is a submerged aquatic plant found in shallow coastal waters, particularly in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has ribbon-like leaves that are typically 2–5 cm long and arranged in whorls around the stem. It plays a crucial role in stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for marine organisms. Halophila aschersonii is also important in the nitrogen cycle of marine ecosystems.
